subject: Inheritance
msgSnippet: Did any one test inheritance successfully, will you please send me the classes under the test and the associated testing classes. We have strictly followed all
messageBody:
Did any one test inheritance successfully, will you
please send me the classes under the test and the
associated testing classes.

We have strictly followed all the steps necessary to
write the testing classes. While running the testing
the subclass picks up the test menthods from the super
class. But failed to run.

We have used Account class and its subclass interest
class as classes under test.
We have created AccoutJU class to test Account class
and InterestJU class to test interest. InterestJU is
the subclass of AccountJU.
Thanks
==============
Account Class
==============
public class Account {

// This member variable will hold account balance
public int balance;

// constructor
public Account(int amount) {
balance = amount;
}

// this mehtod gets the balance
public int getBalance() {
return balance;
}

// this method deposits the money
public int deposit(int amount) {
balance += amount;
return balance;
}

// this mthod withdraw the money
public int withdraw(int amount) {
if (amount <= balance )
{
balance -= amount;
return amount;
}
else
{
return 0;
}
}

}
=================================
Testing class to test Account
============================
import junit.framework.*;

public class AccountJU extends TestCase {

private Account MyAccount;

// Constructor
public AccountJU(String name) {
super(name);
} // End of constuctor

public static void main(String args[]) {
junit.textui.TestRunner.run(new
TestSuite(AccountJU.class));
} // End of main

public void setUp() {
MyAccount = new Account(10000);
}
public void testgetBalance() {
//getBalance
} // End of method

public void testdeposit() {
assertEquals(MyAccount.deposit(3000), 13000);
} // End of method

public void testwithdraw() {
assertEquals(MyAccount.withdraw(15000), 0);
} // End of method


public void testwithdraw2() {
assertEquals(MyAccount.withdraw(4000), 4000);
}//End of method
//End
} // End of class
===========================
Interest Class
======================
public class Interest extends Account {

// This member variable will hold account balance
private int interest_rate;
private int acumulated_interest;

public Interest(int a) {
super(a);
}

// this mehtod sets the interest rate
public int setInterestRate(int ir) {
acumulated_interest = 0;
interest_rate = ir;
return interest_rate;
}

// this method calculates interest
public int calcInterest(int amount, int rate) {
acumulated_interest = amount * rate;
return acumulated_interest;
}

}
===============================
Testing class for Interest class
============================
import junit.framework.*;

public class InterestJU extends AccountJU {

private Interest testOBJ;


public InterestJU(String name) {
super(name);
}

public static void main(String args[]) {
junit.textui.TestRunner.run(new
TestSuite(InterestJU.class));
}

public void setUp() {
super.setUp();
testOBJ = new Interest(10000);
}

protected void tearDown() throws Exception {
super.tearDown();
}
// The next method tests the set interest rate
method
public void testsetInterestRate() {
assertEquals("Test Case1", 6,
testOBJ.setInterestRate(6));
}

// the next method tests the calculate interest
method
public void testcalcInterest() {
assertEquals(testOBJ.calcInterest(500, 6),
3000);
}

}
